content: As a big fan of pinball and video games alike this game just feels perfect to me

The missions are nearly impossible. With little time and a happenstance advantage, it's highly unlikely that a mission will be completed before losing a ball. Wasted effort... I also have a problem with the ball constantly shooting for the outer margins, or going straight down the middle. I would prefer the nudge be disabled. My fingers are long and I prefer to hit the top of the screen and don't want to nudge the table when I want to use the flippers. Maybe it's just me...

content: Very good adaptation of the ever so great Portal games.

Seriously authentic feel in terms of the physics and a really well themed table which captures Portal 2 brilliantly, and yet it's incredibly hard to get beyond a couple of test chambers without the need for tokens on account of the ball so often falling directly between the flippers and down the outlanes. I reckon it needs a little more balancing in this respect, but pinball fanatics may disagree. Either way, having a lot of fun. :)
Really well done, brings in the portal elements nicely.
Great games. Confusing missions

Great game. It gets the essence of Portal.

Good game. Some parts, mainly the tests, are confusing though. Every time I start a test, I honestly have no idea what I'm meant to do. And the table-guide is more vague than helpful. "Shoot the flashing lanes indicated". What flashing lanes? It would be much better if, the first time a test begins, there is a cutscene that actually shows what you need to hit etc., instead of just Gladys saying "This test involves turrets."

For starters, the ball moves way too fast.  WAY too fast.  Second, the display in the upper left with messages about the gameplay.. You can't read it because it's small and the ball is moving so fast you can't take your eyes off it.   Another thing, more layouts would be great.  There are only 2.  The first gives a good view of the board but not the ball.  The second gives a better view of the ball but not the whole board.  Anyway,  I like the game but it needs tweaks before I can give it more than 3 stars.

content: As always for a zen pinball table wtg

Great pinball game, good physics and love the portal theme. Was wondering since you guys have the portal license if any plans for a mobile version of portal was in the works. Been a devout gamer since pong and Portal 2 is hands down my all time favorite video game. You actually felt smarter by playing it. Would be a dream come true to have that fun on the go.

content: The table is awesome and the game runs smooth but the in app purchases is something that can't get 5 stars from me

Fantastic

As an absolute Portal addict, I had to have this. No matter how bad, it was to be mine. Zen didn't disappoint in this one, the quality showing through like all of their other tables. One of the best $2 I have ever spent on Android.
When I heard Portal pinball was coming, I was super excited and hopeful, and this doesn't disappoint. It feels like you're in Aperture Laboratories. Look forward to more tables being released.
replyContent: Thank you, Matt! We're happy that it lived up to the hype!

content: Unplayable due to right flipper issues.
replyContent: Hi Drew, make sure you have magnification gestures turned off. Just go to:  Settings > Accessibility > Magnification gestures. Let us know if that doesn't help.

content: This is one of the most addicting, intuitive, and just overall fun pinball tables I have ever played. Valve's distinct & flashy art style of the Portal series combined with an interesting pinball game play experience brings a whole new dimension of science.
